subject: Non unit tests (package tests and sample client use tests)
msgSnippet: Hi, fairly new to junit testing, I have this package where each class has a corresponding test case class. I ended up making a packeage test case that ran all
messageBody:
Hi, fairly new to junit testing, I have this package where each class has a
corresponding test case class. I ended up making a packeage test case that
ran all the rest as well as some of it's own. I find myself writing a sample
usage (outside the package) - something a client would do or use as an
example or maybe to load test. So I made this guy run the package test and
then his own tests. Seems like we will end up with some kind of hierarchy of
tests.

We make web apps and do some web services, so we will have a few different
kinds of test (cactus, httpunut, ...)

I'm sure that the engineers and qa people have been inventing this stuff for
50 years. Otoh, we may not want to inherit all of that. faqs like
http://www.faqs.org/faqs/software-eng/testing-faq/ may be some kind of happy
medium?

I was wondering kinds of hierarchies and what dependencies between the types
and levels of testing that people who use junit have invented?

Any pointers will be appreciated.

Thanks
